TopicTitle: [1.4.3]ALCOR,"Advanced Landing Capsule for Orbital Rendezvous" by ASET (08/02/2017)

Articles.Content:
This is listed as not working in .25. I loved it in my old game and I would greatly enjoy continuing its use. Does anyone know if it is compatible? Had to clear the local files since I was using a variety of mods that, sadly, didnt update. Broke the save :'(
It works for me as well, first time using it as well, and i love it

hi

I have a little problem when I want to use ALCOLOR Capsule, I have this message that erreur playing.

RasterPropMonitor: INITIALIZATION ERROR, CHECK SYSTEM.

By working against RaterPropMonitor for another capsule; would you have any idea?

Sorry for my bad english

All I can say is wow. I would love to see more IVA's with this level of detail and fidelity. Any more plans?

All I can say is wow. I would love to see more IVA's with this level of detail and fidelity. Any more plans?

He also has http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94947-Exploration-Rover-System-by-A-S-E-T-%2810-10-14%29 and http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86343-New-project-from-ASET and we are waitting for this http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79880-WIP-KONQUEST-Modular-components-for-permanent-bases-by-ASET-%2814-05-2014%29
O ok ive seen some of thoes I love Konquest and am excited for when it is downloadable

I absolutely love this pod, I get the feeling it will be my main pod for a lot of missions.

Two quick questions: First, I assume most of buttons in IVA don't do anything, right? (although I do really like the buttons that do do stuff, like the reserve lock, stage lock, lights etc.

Second, how do I exit the craft in IVA? my kerbals just landed home and I wanted to exit and survey the landing site before returning to KSC, only to find I can't find the button to exit; I then started thinking maybe it has some safety lock that needs to be deactivated first and started pressing some other buttons, but still,

Edit: I found the little dial to turn to get out, ignore the IVA exiting question. I really like this mod

Edited December 5, 2014 by TThor

I assume most of buttons in IVA don't do anything, right?

Almost everything on the panel in front of the pilot's chair have some function or other. On the right, most of them do also. Several are reserved and only have a function if MecJeb is installed. There really isn't any better (or more fun) way to find out the functions of the buttons than to just experiment! In my opinion, Alexustas' IVA's are simply the best in the game. I'd love to see some additonal integration (like Docking Port Alignment Indicator) but I still think this is great

hmm the only that make this better is to have someone please program all the props although of course some would only work if certain mods are installed like the reserves dial only for when a capacitor from near future is onboard....
I noticed this mod hasn't been updated in a while? Is that because it simply doesn't need an update yet, or is this mod abandoned? I would be sad if it potentially stops working with .90 and beyond

It isn't abandoned. In one of his other mod threads, the developer Alesustas said:

"Sorry folks, but I have a lot of RL work right now, and seems like I'll be busy at least till mid-December. I will return back to continue my work on projects when i will have more free time."
Still seems to work in 0.90 with RPM for 0.90 installed.

Still seems to work in 0.90 with RPM for 0.90 installed.

I just tried it today and all the screens for ALCOR are garbled, while the screen for other pods are fine. =s Wonder what I did wrong.
Does your install match

Does your install match http://i.imgur.com/Zy2GNPk.png

Yes.

Here is what it is like for ALCOR:

But for others:

ALCOR screens are actually still functional, and it seemed like I can switch them to other things with buttons, but everything is garbled.

Edited December 26, 2014 by RainDreamer
Are you running ATM ?
You have to delete the atm config for alcor or modify it to exclude the rpm config same happened to me just deleted the atm config fixed it
Ah, yes, I do run ATM. How do I modify it to exclude the RPM config for ALCOR then?
You need to go to Gamedata/ActiveTextureManagement/ActiveTextureManagerConfigs and open "ASET.cfg", after that you just need to replace "true" by "false"

Hmm, so ALCOR screen is still giving me garbled stuff after modifying ATM config file for ASET. I even remove ATM for the test and it still have garbled screen, and other screens are not affected.

I think I might have a corrupted file from download or something? Will try again with a new download and see.

EDIT - nope, new download, same problem. Hmm...
